perturbation.original_text:
VerticalNet shall furnish PaperExchange with
a full color representation of each VerticalNet Link at least two days prior to
its scheduled placement on a page of the PaperExchange Site. If VerticalNet
subsequently modifies any VerticalNet Link or the URL associated with such
VerticalNet Link, it shall furnish a representation of same to PaperExchange,
which PaperExchange shall substitute for the prior version within two days after
receipt thereof. VerticalNet shall have final approval over all VerticalNet
Links on the PaperExchange Site.
perturbation.changed_text:
VerticalNet shall furnish PaperExchange with
a full color representation of each VerticalNet Link at least one day prior to
its scheduled placement on a page of the PaperExchange Site. If VerticalNet
subsequently modifies any VerticalNet Link or the URL associated with such
VerticalNet Link, it shall furnish a representation of same to PaperExchange,
which PaperExchange shall substitute for the prior version within one day after
receipt thereof. VerticalNet shall have final approval over all VerticalNet
Links on the PaperExchange Site.
perturbation.explanation: The change in the deadline from two days to one day for providing and substituting the VerticalNet Link representation creates a legal contradiction. While seemingly minor, such compressed timelines can violate standard business practice laws, particularly regarding reasonable notice and opportunity to review, especially in cases where integration requires technical expertise.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, potentially violating reasonable business practices.

perturbation.original_text:
PaperExchange shall place the
VerticalNet Links in a mutually agreeable location and size on the PaperExchange
Site as soon as practicable and in no event more than 15 days after the
Effective Date. The VerticalNet Links shall remain on the PaperExchange Site
during the Term.
perturbation.changed_text:
PaperExchange shall place the
VerticalNet Links in a mutually agreeable location and size on the PaperExchange
Site as soon as practicable and in no event more than 45 days after the
Effective Date. The VerticalNet Links shall remain on the PaperExchange Site
during the Term.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the implementation deadline from 15 to 45 days after the effective date may contradict standards requiring timely implementation in commercial agreements. Delaying the link placement could cause a significant loss of advertising revenue, especially if it is a material part of the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract due to failure to meet agreed-upon timelines, potentially violating implied duty of good faith.

perturbation.original_text:
VerticalNet and PaperExchange shall co-promote the
PaperExchange Home Page and Pulp and Paper Online in mutually agreeable
advertising and collateral marketing material. All co-promotion advertising
materials produced by or on behalf of either party (the "Originating Party")
shall be subject to the written approval of the other party (the "Receiving
Party"), which approval shall not to be unreasonably withheld, delayed or
conditioned. The Receiving Party shall notify the Originating Party of its
approval or disapproval of such advertising materials as soon as practicable,
but in any event within five business days after Receiving Party's receipt
thereof. Any failure of the Receiving Party to respond within such five business
day period shall be deemed disapproval of the advertising materials in question.
perturbation.changed_text:
VerticalNet and PaperExchange shall co-promote the
PaperExchange Home Page and Pulp and Paper Online in mutually agreeable
advertising and collateral marketing material. All co-promotion advertising
materials produced by or on behalf of either party (the "Originating Party")
shall be subject to the written approval of the other party (the "Receiving
Party"), which approval shall not to be unreasonably withheld, delayed or
conditioned. The Receiving Party shall notify the Originating Party of its
approval or disapproval of such advertising materials as soon as practicable,
but in any event within ten business days after Receiving Party's receipt
thereof. Any failure of the Receiving Party to respond within such ten business
day period shall be deemed approval of the advertising materials in question.
perturbation.explanation: The change from five business days for approval to ten business days, and converting a failure to respond from a disapproval to an approval, introduces a legal risk. This could violate standard practices requiring clear and prompt communication. Changing the default to approval without express confirmation can conflict with standard business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially contradicts principles of clear agreement and consent in contract law.Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing. May violate reasonable business practices.
